member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ArcGISServer.CatalogDcom
member.summary: An ArcGIS Server Catalog proxy used when communicating with the server over DCOM.
member.remarks: Asynchronous methods inherited from the Web service proxy base class are not supported over DCOM. This includes the Begin\End and Async\Completed patterns. More specifically any asynchronous method names that start with Begin or End or end with Async are not supported. Any asynchronous events that end with Completed are not supported.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ArcGISServer.CatalogDcom.#ctor(ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.AGS.AGSServerConnection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Indicates if the connection should be released on Dispose.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ArcGISServer.CatalogDcom.#ctor(ESRI.ArcGIS.Server.IServerObjectManager)
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ArcGISServer.CatalogDcom.GetServiceDescriptionsEx(System.String)
member.summary: Obtains the descriptions for the GIS services in the specified folder.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ArcGISServer.CatalogDcom.GetServiceDescriptions
member.summary: Obtains the descriptions for GIS services on the server.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ArcGISServer.CatalogDcom.GetFolders
member.summary: Obtains a list of folders on the GIS server.
member.returns: Array of names of the folders.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ArcGISServer.CatalogDcom.GetMessageFormats
member.summary: Obtains the message format (SOAP and/or binary) for the catalog.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ArcGISServer.CatalogDcom.GetMessageVersion
member.summary: Gets the version of the server's messages.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ArcGISServer.MapServerDcomProxy
member.summary: An ArcGIS Server map server proxy used when communicating with the server over DCOM.
member.remarks: Asynchronous methods inherited from the Web service proxy base class are not supported over DCOM. This includes the Begin\End and Async\Completed patterns. More specifically any asynchronous method names that start with Begin or End or end with Async are not supported. Any asynchronous events that end with Completed are not supported.

code.description: This example illustrates how to create a MapServerDcomProxy and call ExportMapImage to generate a new map image.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ArcGISServer.DcomProxy
member.summary: This class handles the communication with the ArcGIS Server machine when using SOAP over DCOM.
member.remarks:
For a discussion of communication with ArcGIS Server, see the topic
ArcGIS Server Implementation in the Web ADF in the Developer Help (also available online at the
ArcGIS Resource Center.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ArcGISServer.DcomProxy.#ctor(ESRI.ArcGIS.esriSystem.IRequestHandler)
member.summary: Constructs a new DcomProxy instance.
member.param: The ArcGIS Server component that will communicate with the server, for example, a MapServer instance.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ArcGISServer.DcomProxy.#ctor(System.String,ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Identity,System.String,System.String,System.String)

member.summary: Converts an ArcGIS Server object from its .NET proxy "value" type to the corresponding COM type.
member.remarks:
For a discussion of conversion between value and COM objects with ArcGIS Server see the page
ArcGIS Server: COM and Value objects in the Web ADF Developer Help (also available online at the
ArcGIS Resource Center.
member.param: The ArcGIS Server context that will host the COM object.

For a discussion of conversion between value and COM objects with ArcGIS Server see the page
ArcGIS Server: COM and Value objects in the Web ADF Developer Help (also available online at the
ArcGIS Resource Center.
member.summary: Converts an ArcGIS Server COM object to its .NET value object equivalent.
member.param: The ArcGIS Server COM object to convert.
The ArcGIS Server context that will perform the conversion.
The .NET proxy type in the Web ADF to convert to.

member.remarks:
For a discussion of communication with ArcGIS Server, see the topic
ArcGIS Server Implementation in the Web ADF in the Developer Help (also available online at the
ArcGIS Resource Center.
